file_content.text: I've restored Laranna Fain to the light. She is in the brig and won't cause any harm.
Laranna Fain is well again.
Are you sure, Jedi? I mean, she killed a lot of my people.
You're perfectly safe.
I'm sure.
I know. She will face justice for it, don't worry.
She won't go unpunished.
I trust you. You saved our lives. And if Laranna's in the brig, she should be secure there.
Are you suggesting that you know better than a Jedi?
Don't question me.
No, of course not. You saved our lives. And if Laranna's in the brig, she should be secure there.
You don't need to worry about Laranna Fain anymore. I've killed her.
Laranna Fain is dead.
That's... I'm not sure what to say. She killed a lot of good people, but she saved us from the Imperials.
Still, I feel safer with her dead, so I guess I should thank you.
I did only what was necessary.
No need for thanks.
No sense mourning the wicked.
Don't dwell on Laranna.
It was nothing.
I'll report back to Master Syo immediately. You should do the same.
Once we get the ship back under control, we'll set a course for Coruscant. Thank you for everything, Jedi.
Laranna, my child, my appr--Jedi. So, you have robbed me of a most promising student.
As if that will delay the inevitable. You Jedi are an endless source of amusement.
We meet at last, plaguemaster.
I've been waiting for this.
You know nothing of me, but I know all about your order. Once I served the Jedi Council blindly, as you do.
Is that why you created this plague? For your amusement?
So this is all a joke to you.
For power. I was once a Jedi like yourself, a mindless drone to the order's precious code.
The light will always triumph over the darkness, Vivicar.
You won't win.
Ah yes, those platitudes are so familiar. I once thought the same thing.
"There is no emotion, only peace." I believed. But the teachings of the Dark Lord Terrak Morrhage showed me the error of my ways.
Thousands of years ago, Morrhage's hatred nearly crushed the Jedi. That is true power.
I already know how to stop the plague.
I know how to defeat you.
You mean your shielding technique? The Jedi do love repeating their mistakes.
By killing those you could instead shield? Ha.
The hunger for increasing power becomes an endless spiral.
Such beliefs are destructive.
Is that why you persist in using that worthless shielding technique?
Yet you kill my pets when you could instead show restraint.
Show yourself in person, and we'll see how powerful you are.
Then why are you hiding?
How much of your own strength have you sacrificed to shield the Masters?
You know how the originator of that technique died, don't you? He sacrificed too much of himself and perished, nameless.
Everyone I have ever touched could fall to this plague. You cannot shield them all.
What if I used my shielding technique on you?
I can shield you.
Haven't you tired of killing? You know the shielding technique. Why don't you use it?
Not that it'll do you any good. The plague has already served its purpose.
Everyone I have ever touched is susceptible to the plague. Will you kill them all?
I will find another way to stop you.
There's always a way.
If you're dead, the plague ends. Am I right?
I could kill you.
My power is already beyond your comprehension, and every moment makes me stronger.
Boasting won't guarantee you victory.
You're all talk.
Victory is already guaranteed, Jedi.
You are too late. I've already won.
